title: Herbal Therapy in Patients With HIV
author: Virna Almuete; RPh; BS
description: Pharmacists can proactively educate HIV patients on potential adverse effects resulting from drug-herbal interactions.
cleaned_text: Introduction The use of complementary and alternative medical (CAM) therapy has increased over the past decade.[ [1](javascript:void(0);), [2](javascript:void(0);)] A recent nationwide survey indicated that 42% of participants admitted to CAM therapy use within the previous 12 months. In addition, approximately 12% of the surveyed group acknowledged use of an herbal product. Moreover, among the 44% of respondents who regularly take prescription medications, 18% reported concurrent use of an herbal product, high-dose vitamin supplementation, or both. Costs of herbal therapies alone in the United States are estimated to be $5.1 billion per year.[ [2](javascript:void(0);)] Medscape Pharmacists. 2002;3(2) © 2002 Medscape Cite this: Herbal Therapy in Patients With HIV - Medscape - Jul 03, 2002.
